comments.creator: sten.tibbing@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/10.0.648.204 Safari/534.16
Build Identifier: Firefox 4.0

If an image is changed underneath another image, the first image is showed sometimes producing some flickering. This is not a problem with any other browser or Firefox 3.5

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open up www.elementaryos.org with Firefox 4.0
2.After loading an animated flipclock is showed.
3.Flickering occurs on random animations.

comments.author: joe@drew.ca
comments.text:
Created attachment 644427
test patch: force a sync decode when switching images

This patch will force the image to synchronously decode (if it's not already decoded) by way of a hack. If this fixes the bug, we should create a proper synchronous decode API.
comments.raw_text: This patch will force the image to synchronously decode (if it's not already decoded) by way of a hack. If this fixes the bug, we should create a proper synchronous decode API.
comments.creator: joe@drew.ca
